pylapp.smoothclicker.android.views

Class StandaloneActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • pylapp.smoothclicker.android.views.StandaloneActivity

  • public class StandaloneActivity
extends java.lang.Object
    A kind of main activity of this Smooth Clicker app, more for stand-alone purposes. It parses the JSON file containing the points to click on, it parses also the JSON file containing the configuration to use, and it starts the clicking process with these values. This activity must be used remotely e.g. with Appium thanks to dedicated intent and actions, or thanks to the GUI to trigger this mode. Standalone mode is more for "already-defined-configurations" To click on all the points defined in the JSON file (with the JSON config file too): 
            am start -a pylapp.smoothclicker.android.CLICK_ON_ALL_POINTS -n pylapp.smoothclicker.android/pylapp.smoothclicker.android.views.StandaloneActivity
    To click on all the points defined in the JSON file (with the JSON config file too) but only if the screen state is the same as the scren picture referenced in the app's folder: 
         am start -a pylapp.smoothclicker.android.CLICK_ON_ALL_POINTS_ACCORDING_SCREEN -n pylapp.smoothclicker.android/pylapp.smoothclicker.android.views.StandaloneActivity
    Since:
    10/05/2016
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    pylapp
    See Also:
    AppCompatActivity

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String ACTION_ALL_POINTS
      Make the standalone process click all the points defined in the JSON points file using the JSON config file
      static java.lang.String ACTION_ALL_POINTS_ACCORDING_SCREEN
      Make the standalone process click on all the point of the JSON points file and with the use of an OCR-like system which can trigger the click process according to a picture (e.g. file of a picture with the very button I want to click on)

      private java.util.List<PointsListAdapter.Point> mPointsToClickOn
